About Me

Jan 20, 2018


I’m a Masters student in Computer Science at UCL.

I write code in Javascript, Java, and Python.

Some of the things I’ve built include a tool to help the visually impaired use the internet, and a faster, cheaper and a more accurate test for macular degeneration. You can find more of my projects here and the code on Github.

I previously co-founded Proteam.

Prior to that, I studied Medicine at Cambridge. Where I was President of the Cambridge StartUp Society which had some pretty cool speakers, including startup founders and venture capitalists.

Here’s my CV.

I’m always keen to here about new projects or grab coffee, contact me at luke.harries@me.com

Currently, MSc Computer Science at UCL. Previously, Cambridge Medicine. Always a Geek striving to make the world a better place.
